feed.title: Google Cloud: Cloud Composer
feed.subtitle: Changelog for Google Cloud product: Cloud Composer

entry.content: A new Cloud Composer release has started on October 22, 2025. Get ready for upcoming changes and features as we roll out the new release to all regions. This release is in progress at the moment. Listed changes and features might not be available in some regions yet.
entry.summary: A new release of Cloud Composer is rolling out starting October 22, 2025, bringing upcoming changes and features to all regions.
entry.title: Announcement: Cloud Composer Release

entry.content: The default value of the NO_PROXY environment variable now includes the IP address of the environment's cluster Compute Engine metadata server.
entry.summary: The NO_PROXY environment variable now includes the IP address of the environment's cluster Compute Engine metadata server.
entry.title: Changed: Updated NO_PROXY environment variable

entry.content:
(Airflow 2.10.5) The apache-airflow-providers-google package was upgraded to version 18.0.0 in Cloud Composer 2 images and Cloud Composer 3 builds.

For more information about changes, see the apache-airflow-providers-google changelog from version 17.2.0 to version 18.0.0.
entry.summary: The apache-airflow-providers-google package has been upgraded to version 18.0.0 in Cloud Composer 2 images and Cloud Composer 3 builds.
entry.title: Changed: Google provider package upgraded in Cloud Composer

entry.content: (Airflow 2.10.5) The apache-airflow-providers-cncf-kubernetes package was upgraded to version 10.8.2. For changes in other packages, see the preinstalled packages changelog.
entry.summary: The apache-airflow-providers-cncf-kubernetes package has been upgraded to version 10.8.2.
entry.title: Changed: Airflow Kubernetes provider upgraded

entry.content:
New Airflow builds are available in Cloud Composer 3:

  • composer-3-airflow-2.10.5-build.17 (default)
  • composer-3-airflow-2.9.3-build.37
entry.summary: New Airflow builds are now available for Cloud Composer 3, including the default composer-3-airflow-2.10.5-build.17 and composer-3-airflow-2.9.3-build.37.
entry.title: Changed: New Airflow builds available

entry.content:
New images are available in Cloud Composer 2:

  • composer-2.15.0-airflow-2.10.5 (default)
  • composer-2.15.0-airflow-2.9.3
entry.summary: New images are available for Cloud Composer 2, including composer-2.15.0-airflow-2.10.5 (default) and composer-2.15.0-airflow-2.9.3.
entry.title: Changed: New images available for Cloud Composer 2

entry.content: The following Cloud Composer versions and builds have reached their end of support period: composer-3-airflow-2.7.3-build.20, composer-3-airflow-2.7.3-build.19, composer-2.9.8-*, composer-2.9.7-*.
entry.summary: Certain versions of Cloud Composer, including composer-3-airflow-2.7.3-build.20, composer-3-airflow-2.7.3-build.19, composer-2.9.8-\* and composer-2.9.7-\* have reached their end of support.
entry.title: Deprecated: Cloud Composer Versions Deprecated

entry.content: The following Cloud Composer versions and builds have reached their end of support period: composer-2.9.6-*, composer-3-airflow-2.7.3-build.17, composer-3-airflow-2.7.3-build.18, composer-3-airflow-2.9.1-build.8, and composer-3-airflow-2.9.1-build.9.
entry.summary: Certain Cloud Composer versions are no longer supported. Please update to a supported version to avoid disruptions.
entry.title: Deprecated: Cloud Composer Versions End of Support

entry.content: (Cloud Composer 2 versions from 2.12.0 to 2.12.3) Fixed a problem where Airflow components in the environment's cluster were running out of ephemeral storage. This change rolls out gradually over several releases to all regions supported by Cloud Composer 2.
entry.summary: A storage issue affecting Airflow components in Cloud Composer 2 environments has been resolved. This fix addresses problems where components ran out of ephemeral storage.
entry.title: Fixed: Ephemeral storage issue fixed in Cloud Composer 2

entry.content:
New Airflow builds are available in Cloud Composer 3:

  • composer-3-airflow-2.10.5-build.16 (default)
  • composer-3-airflow-2.9.3-build.36
entry.summary: New Airflow builds for Cloud Composer 3 are now available.
entry.title: Changed: Airflow builds updated

entry.content:
New images are available in Cloud Composer 2:

  • composer-2.14.4-airflow-2.10.5 (default)
  • composer-2.14.4-airflow-2.9.3
entry.summary: New images are available for Cloud Composer 2, including composer-2.14.4-airflow-2.10.5 (default) and composer-2.14.4-airflow-2.9.3.
entry.title: Changed: New Images Available

entry.content: Upgrade checks are now generally available (GA) in Cloud Composer 3 and Cloud Composer 2.
entry.summary: Upgrade checks are now generally available for Cloud Composer 3 and 2.
entry.title: Feature: Upgrade Checks Now GA

entry.content: The GCE_METADATA_TIMEOUT environment variable is changed to reserved. This change addresses an issue where setting a low timeout value disrupted the environment's operations that relied on the metadata server.
entry.summary: The GCE_METADATA_TIMEOUT environment variable has been changed to reserved. This resolves an issue where a low timeout value could disrupt operations reliant on the metadata server.
entry.title: Fixed: Metadata server timeout is now reserved

entry.content: DAG UI now correctly generates error messages about malformed serialized DAG.
entry.summary: The DAG UI has been updated to correctly generate error messages when encountering malformed serialized DAGs.
entry.title: Fixed: Malformed DAGs now show errors

entry.content:
(Airflow 2.10.5) The apache-airflow-providers-google package was upgraded to version 17.2.0 in Cloud Composer 2 images and Cloud Composer 3 builds.

For more information about changes, see the apache-airflow-providers-google changelog from version 17.1.0 to version 17.2.0.
entry.summary: The apache-airflow-providers-google package has been upgraded to version 17.2.0.
entry.title: Changed: Airflow package upgraded

entry.content: (Airflow 2.10.5) CloudComposerDAGRunSensor is broken in the apache-airflow-providers-google package version 17.2.0. This package is used by Cloud Composer versions and builds with Airflow 2.10.5 available in this release. If your DAGs use this sensor, we recommend you postpone upgrading until the issue is resolved.
entry.summary: Cloud Composer 2.10.5 users: CloudComposerDAGRunSensor in apache-airflow-providers-google v17.2.0 is broken. Please postpone upgrades if your DAGs use this sensor.
entry.title: Issue: Cloud Composer Issue

entry.content: (Airflow 2.10.5) The apache-airflow-providers-cncf-kubernetes package was upgraded to version 10.8.0 from version 10.7.0. For changes in other packages, see the preinstalled packages changelog.
entry.summary: The apache-airflow-providers-cncf-kubernetes package has been upgraded to version 10.8.0.
entry.title: Changed: Airflow Kubernetes Provider Updated

entry.content:
New Airflow builds are available in Cloud Composer 3:

  • composer-3-airflow-2.10.5-build.15 (default)
  • composer-3-airflow-2.9.3-build.35
entry.summary: New Airflow builds are available for Cloud Composer 3, including composer-3-airflow-2.10.5-build.15 (default) and composer-3-airflow-2.9.3-build.35.
entry.title: Changed: New Airflow builds available

entry.content:
New images are available in Cloud Composer 2:

  • composer-2.14.3-airflow-2.10.5 (default)
  • composer-2.14.3-airflow-2.9.3
entry.summary: New images for Cloud Composer 2 are now available, including composer-2.14.3-airflow-2.10.5 (default) and composer-2.14.3-airflow-2.9.3.
entry.title: Changed: New Images Available

entry.content: The following Cloud Composer versions and builds have reached their end of support period: composer-2.9.4-*, composer-3-airflow-2.9.1 builds from build.0 to build.7, and composer-3-airflow-2.7.3-build.16.
entry.summary: Certain Cloud Composer versions are no longer supported. Please update to a supported version.
entry.title: Deprecated: Cloud Composer versions deprecated

entry.content:
New Airflow builds are available in Cloud Composer 3:

  • composer-3-airflow-2.10.5-build.14 (default)
  • composer-3-airflow-2.9.3-build.34
entry.summary: New Airflow builds for Cloud Composer 3 are now available. The default build is composer-3-airflow-2.10.5-build.14, and composer-3-airflow-2.9.3-build.34 is also available.
entry.title: Changed: New Airflow builds available

entry.content:
New images are available in Cloud Composer 2:

  • composer-2.14.2-airflow-2.10.5 (default)
  • composer-2.14.2-airflow-2.9.3
entry.summary: New images are available for Cloud Composer 2, including composer-2.14.2-airflow-2.10.5 (default) and composer-2.14.2-airflow-2.9.3.
entry.title: Changed: New images available for Cloud Composer 2

entry.content: Fixed an issue where values of Airflow configuration options were evaluated before being set. As a result, the actual value was set to the evaluated result.
entry.summary: An issue where Airflow configuration option values were evaluated before being set has been resolved. The configuration options will now be set to their correct values.
entry.title: Fixed: Configuration options evaluation fixed

entry.content: Fixed Airflow logs not exporting to Cloud Logging because of a GKE version mismatch between Airflow worker and GKE Control plane nodes.
entry.summary: The issue preventing Airflow logs from exporting to Cloud Logging has been resolved. This was caused by a GKE version mismatch between Airflow worker and GKE Control plane nodes.
entry.title: Fixed: Airflow logs export fixed

entry.content: (Cloud Composer 2) Cloud Composer's high availability infrastructure was enhanced to provide greater resilience against zonal outages. This change rolls out gradually over several releases to all regions supported by Cloud Composer 2.
entry.summary: Cloud Composer 2 now offers enhanced high availability infrastructure to better withstand zonal outages. This improvement is being rolled out across all supported regions.
entry.title: Feature: Cloud Composer 2 High Availability

entry.content: (Available without upgrading) Cloud Composer 3 now supports DNS resolution for regional service endpoints. You can now reach regional service endpoints from DAGs in your environment. This change is available in Public IP environments without additional configuration. For Private IP environments, an environment must be connected to a VPC network where private endpoints are configured.
entry.summary: Cloud Composer 3 now supports DNS resolution for regional service endpoints, allowing you to reach them from your DAGs. This feature is available in Public IP environments without extra configuration and in Private IP environments when connected to a VPC network with private endpoints configured.
entry.title: Feature: Cloud Composer 3 Now Supports DNS Resolution for Regional Service Endpoints

entry.content: You can now check if a Cloud Composer 2 environment's configuration is compatible with Cloud Composer 3. We recommend doing this check before migrating to Cloud Composer 3.
entry.summary: Check your Cloud Composer 2 environment's configuration for compatibility with Cloud Composer 3 before upgrading.
entry.title: Feature: Cloud Composer 3 Upgrade Compatibility Check

entry.content:
New Airflow builds are available in Cloud Composer 3:

  • composer-3-airflow-2.10.5-build.13 (default)
  • composer-3-airflow-2.9.3-build.33
entry.summary: New Airflow builds are available for Cloud Composer 3, including the default composer-3-airflow-2.10.5-build.13 and composer-3-airflow-2.9.3-build.33.
entry.title: Changed: New Airflow builds available

entry.content:
New images are available in Cloud Composer 2:

  • composer-2.14.1-airflow-2.10.5 (default)
  • composer-2.14.1-airflow-2.9.3
entry.summary: New images for Cloud Composer 2 are now available. The default image is composer-2.14.1-airflow-2.10.5, and composer-2.14.1-airflow-2.9.3 is also available.
entry.title: Changed: New images available

entry.content: The following Cloud Composer versions and builds have reached their end of support period: composer-2.9.2-* and composer-2.9.3-*.
entry.summary: Certain versions of Cloud Composer, specifically composer-2.9.2-* and composer-2.9.3-*, are no longer supported. This announcement serves as a notification for users of these versions.
entry.title: Deprecated: Cloud Composer Versions Deprecation

entry.content:
Improved the startup times of Airflow workers for environments that have a large number of custom PyPI packages installed.

This feature was announced previously and has finished gradually rolling out to all regions supported by Cloud Composer.
entry.summary: Airflow worker startup times have been improved, especially for environments with many custom PyPI packages. This enhancement is now available in all supported Cloud Composer regions.
entry.title: Feature: Faster Airflow Worker Startups

entry.content: Airflow UI now shows the correct value of the [core]dags_folder Airflow configuration option.
entry.summary: The Airflow UI now correctly displays the value of the `[core]dags_folder` configuration option.
entry.title: Fixed: Airflow UI DAGs Folder Value Fixed

entry.content:
(Airflow 2.10.5) The apache-airflow-providers-google package was upgraded to version 17.1.0 in Cloud Composer 2 images and Cloud Composer 3 builds.

For more information about changes, see the apache-airflow-providers-google changelog from version 15.1.0 to version 17.1.0.
entry.summary: The apache-airflow-providers-google package has been upgraded to version 17.1.0.
entry.title: Changed: Airflow providers google package upgraded

entry.content: (Airflow 2.10.5) The apache-airflow-providers-cncf-kubernetes package was upgraded to version 10.7.0 from version 10.6.1. For changes in other packages, see the preinstalled packages changelog.

entry.title: Changed: Airflow Kubernetes provider upgraded

entry.content: The following Cloud Composer versions and builds have reached their end of support period: composer-2.9.0, composer-2.9.1, and composer-3-airflow-2.7.3 builds from build.5 to build.13.
entry.summary: Certain Cloud Composer versions are no longer supported. Please update to a supported version.
entry.title: Deprecated: Cloud Composer Versions Deprecation

entry.content:
New images are available in Cloud Composer 2:

  • composer-2.13.9-airflow-2.10.5 (default)
  • composer-2.13.9-airflow-2.9.3
entry.summary: New images are available for Cloud Composer 2, including composer-2.13.9-airflow-2.10.5 (default) and composer-2.13.9-airflow-2.9.3.
entry.title: Changed: New images available

entry.content: Cloud Composer versions 2.8.7 and 2.8.8 have reached their end of support period.
entry.summary: Cloud Composer versions 2.8.7 and 2.8.8 are no longer supported. This is a standard deprecation for the product. For more information, see the versioning overview.
entry.title: Deprecated: Cloud Composer versions deprecated

entry.content: (Cloud Composer 2) Moved the update_fab_perms option from [webserver] to [fab] in the Airflow configuration. The corresponding deprecation warning is no longer generated in Airflow web server logs.
entry.summary: The `update_fab_perms` option has been moved from the `[webserver]` section to the `[fab]` section in the Airflow configuration for Cloud Composer 2. This change eliminates the deprecation warning previously seen in Airflow web server logs.
entry.title: Changed: Cloud Composer 2: FAB Permissions Update

entry.content:
(Airflow 2.10.5 only) Added task-level resource consumption Airflow metrics to Cloud Composer.

  • composer.googleapis.com/workflow/task/cpu_usage: percentage of CPU used by a task.
  • composer.googleapis.com/workflow/task/cpu_usage: percentage of memory used by a task.
entry.summary: New metrics for task CPU and memory usage are now available in Cloud Composer.
entry.title: Feature: Task-level resource consumption metrics

entry.content:
New Airflow builds are available in Cloud Composer 3:

  • composer-3-airflow-2.10.5-build.11 (default)
  • composer-3-airflow-2.9.3-build.31
entry.summary: New Airflow builds are now available for Cloud Composer 3. The default is composer-3-airflow-2.10.5-build.11, with composer-3-airflow-2.9.3-build.31 also available.
entry.title: Changed: New Airflow builds for Cloud Composer 3

entry.content: Fixed an issue that caused unexpected restarts of Airflow component workloads in the environment's cluster.
entry.summary: Fixed unexpected restarts of Airflow component workloads.
entry.title: Fixed: Airflow component restarts fixed

entry.content: (Cloud Composer 3) The DAGS_FOLDER reserved environment variable now correctly points to the local directory where DAG files are stored.
entry.summary: The DAGs folder now correctly points to the local DAGs directory.
entry.title: Fixed: Cloud Composer 3: Fixed DAGs Folder Path

entry.content:
New Airflow builds are available in Cloud Composer 3:

  • composer-3-airflow-2.10.5-build.10 (default)
  • composer-3-airflow-2.9.3-build.30
entry.summary: New Airflow builds are available for Cloud Composer 3. The default is composer-3-airflow-2.10.5-build.10.
entry.title: Changed: New Airflow Builds Available

entry.content:
New images are available in Cloud Composer 2:

  • composer-2.13.8-airflow-2.10.5 (default)
  • composer-2.13.8-airflow-2.9.3
entry.summary: New images are available for Cloud Composer 2.
entry.title: Changed: New Images Available

entry.content: Cloud Composer version 2.8.6 has reached its end of support period.
entry.summary: Cloud Composer version 2.8.6 is deprecated.
entry.title: Deprecated: Cloud Composer 2.8.6 Deprecation

entry.content: Web server restarting is is now generally available (GA) in Cloud Composer 2 and Cloud Composer 3.
entry.summary: The web server restarting feature for Cloud Composer 2 and 3 is now generally available.
entry.title: Feature: Web Server Restarting Now GA

entry.content:
If your environment uses dag-factory package version 0.22, then you might experience DAG failures in Cloud Composer versions that have apache-airflow-providers-cncf-kubernetes package version 10.4.2 or later. At the same time, upgrading the dag-factory package to version 0.23 might require you to update your DAG code to make it compatible.

If your environment uses dag-factory version 0.22, we recommend to do the following:

  • Temporarily postpone upgrading your environment until you're ready to switch to dag-factory version 0.23. Last versions of Cloud Composer that support version 0.22 are composer-3-airflow-2.10.5-build.3, composer-3-airflow-2.9.3-build.23, composer-2.13.1-airflow-2.10.5, and composer-2.13.1-airflow-2.9.3 released on May 14, 2025.
  • When you are ready to upgrade, update your DAGs for compatibility with 0.23. We recommend to do this in a development environment first. Install dag-factory version 0.23, then check that your DAGs are parsed and are working correctly, and update them if needed. After your DAGs are compatible, install dag-factory version 0.23 in your production environment and transfer the updated DAGs. Your environment can now be upgraded to a later version of Cloud Composer or Airflow.
  • If your environment is already upgraded to a later version of Cloud Composer and you experience problems, then update dag-factory to version 0.23 and update your DAGs for compatibility with 0.23.
entry.summary: This announcement provides guidance on potential DAG failures in Cloud Composer when using dag-factory version 0.22 with specific Airflow provider versions. It recommends postponing upgrades or updating to dag-factory version 0.23 with necessary DAG code modifications.
entry.title: Announcement: DAG Failures with dag-factory v0.22

entry.content: Highly resilient environments are now generally available (GA) in Cloud Composer 3.
entry.summary: Cloud Composer 3 now offers generally available highly resilient environments, enhancing the reliability of your workloads.
entry.title: Feature: Highly Resilient Environments Now Available in Cloud Composer 3

entry.content:
We're changing the way we provide support dates for Airflow builds in Cloud Composer 3. Before this change, some Airflow builds had their end of support date listed as "To be announced" until a later Airflow version became available. We're deprecating this approach for all builds that are released after July 01, 2025.

We are now providing support dates that depend on a date when a particular Airflow build was released:

  • We are introducing the standard support period of 12 months after the release date.
  • All Airflow builds that didn't have an end of support date when this change was introduced are supported until July 1, 2026. Because of this change, some Airflow builds released before July 1, 2025 are supported for longer than the standard support period.
  • All Airflow builds that had their support date shorter than 12 months are now supported for 12 months since the date of their initial release.
  • All builds released after July 1, 2025 will use the standard support period.
entry.summary: We are updating the support dates for Airflow builds in Cloud Composer 3. Starting July 1, 2025, all new builds will have a 12-month standard support period from their release date. Existing builds without a defined end of support date will now be supported until July 1, 2026, with some receiving extended support beyond the standard period.
entry.title: Changed: Cloud Composer 3: Updated Airflow Support Dates

entry.content: A new Cloud Composer release has started on July 9, 2025. Get ready for upcoming changes and features as we roll out the new release to all regions. This release is in progress at the moment. Listed changes and features might not be available in some regions yet.
entry.summary: A new Cloud Composer release began on July 9, 2025, and is currently being rolled out to all regions. This release includes new features and changes that may not be available in all regions yet.
entry.title: Announcement: New Cloud Composer Release

entry.content:
We are gradually rolling out a change that switches the default version from Cloud Composer 2 to Cloud Composer 3 in the Cloud Composer API.

In regions where the change is rolled out, a Cloud Composer 3 environment is created by default when a version is not specified in Google Cloud CLI, Cloud Composer API, or Terraform. If you use automation scripts to provision Cloud Composer 2 environments, make sure that you explicitly specify a Cloud Composer 2 version.

In this release, the change is rolling out in the following regions: africa-south1, asia-northeast2, asia-south2, asia-southeast2, europe-southwest1, europe-west10, europe-west12, europe-west8, me-central1, me-central2, me-west1, southamerica-west1, and us-south1.
entry.summary: The Cloud Composer API's default environment version is being updated from Cloud Composer 2 to Cloud Composer 3. This change will affect new environments created without a specified version in certain regions. Users relying on Cloud Composer 2 should explicitly select that version in their automation scripts.
entry.title: Changed: Cloud Composer 3 becomes default

entry.content: (Available without upgrading) During Cloud Composer 2 environment operations, a more informative error message is returned when an environment's web server has connectivity issues.
entry.summary: A more informative error message is now returned for Cloud Composer 2 environments when the web server experiences connectivity issues.
entry.title: Changed: Improved error message for Composer 2 web server connectivity

entry.content:
New Airflow builds are available in Cloud Composer 3:

  • composer-3-airflow-2.10.5-build.9 (default)
  • composer-3-airflow-2.9.3-build.29
entry.summary: New builds for Airflow 2.10.5 and 2.9.3 are now available for Cloud Composer 3.
entry.title: Changed: New Airflow builds for Cloud Composer 3

entry.content:
New images are available in Cloud Composer 2:

  • composer-2.13.7-airflow-2.10.5 (default)
  • composer-2.13.7-airflow-2.9.3
entry.summary: New images for Cloud Composer 2 are available, including composer-2.13.7-airflow-2.10.5 (default) and composer-2.13.7-airflow-2.9.3.
entry.title: Changed: New Cloud Composer 2 Images Available

entry.content: Cloud Composer versions 2.8.4 and 2.8.5 have reached their end of support period.
entry.summary: Cloud Composer versions 2.8.4 and 2.8.5 are no longer supported. Please upgrade to a newer version to continue receiving support.
entry.title: Deprecated: Cloud Composer versions 2.8.4 and 2.8.5 deprecated

entry.content:
Cloud Composer 1 and Cloud Composer 2 environments with version 2.0.x are approaching their end of life. We're planning to deprecate them in the following way:

  • Starting September 15, 2025, you will no longer be able to create new Cloud Composer 1 environments.
  • On September 15, 2026, all Cloud Composer 1 and Cloud Composer 2 version 2.0.x environments will reach their planned end of life, and you won't be able to use them.

Cloud Composer 2 environments with versions later than 2.1.0 and all Cloud Composer 3 environments are not affected by this deprecation.

We recommend planning migration to Cloud Composer 3 or upgrading your Cloud Composer 2 environments to a later version.
entry.summary: Cloud Composer 1 and version 2.0.x of Cloud Composer 2 are nearing their end of life. You won't be able to create new Cloud Composer 1 environments after September 15, 2025. All Cloud Composer 1 and Cloud Composer 2 version 2.0.x environments will be unusable after September 15, 2026. Please migrate to Cloud Composer 3 or upgrade your existing environments.
entry.title: Changed: Cloud Composer 1 and 2 version 2.0.x end of life

entry.content: A new Cloud Composer release has started on July 1, 2025. This release is in progress at the moment. Listed changes might not be available in some regions yet.
entry.summary: A new Cloud Composer release began on July 1, 2025, and is currently in progress. Please note that some changes may not be available in all regions yet.
entry.title: Announcement: Cloud Composer Release Update

entry.content: This release includes internal infrastructure improvements to Cloud Composer. There are no user-visible changes.
entry.summary: This release includes internal infrastructure improvements to Cloud Composer, with no user-facing changes.
entry.title: Changed: Internal improvements to Cloud Composer

entry.content:
New Airflow builds are available in Cloud Composer 3:

  • composer-3-airflow-2.10.5-build.8 (default)
  • composer-3-airflow-2.9.3-build.28
entry.summary: New Airflow builds for Cloud Composer 3 are available, including the latest default version composer-3-airflow-2.10.5-build.8 and composer-3-airflow-2.9.3-build.28.
entry.title: Changed: New Airflow Builds Available

entry.content:
New images are available in Cloud Composer 2:

  • composer-2.13.6-airflow-2.10.5 (default)
  • composer-2.13.6-airflow-2.9.3
entry.summary: New images for Cloud Composer 2 are available, featuring composer-2.13.6 with Airflow 2.10.5 as the default and an option for Airflow 2.9.3.
entry.title: Changed: New Cloud Composer 2 Images Available

entry.content:
Improved the startup times of Airflow workers for environments that have a large number of custom PyPI packages installed.

This feature was announced previously and is gradually rolling out over several releases. In this release, it's available in asia-east2, asia-northeast3, europe-central2, europe-west9, me-central1, me-west1, northamerica-northeast1, northamerica-northeast2, northamerica-south1, and us-west1 re
entry.summary: Startup times for Airflow workers with many custom PyPI packages have been improved. This feature is available in several regions, including asia-east2, europe-central2, and us-west1.
entry.title: Feature: Faster Airflow worker startup

entry.content: (Available without upgrading) Fixed an issue where deleting a Cloud Composer 2 environment could fail when the environment's cluster was in the process of creating a node pool.
entry.summary: Deleting a Cloud Composer 2 environment that was creating a node pool no longer fails.
entry.title: Fixed: Fixed environment deletion issue

entry.content: (Airflow 2.10.5) The apache-airflow-providers-cncf-kubernetes package was upgraded to version 10.5.0 from version 10.4.2. For changes in other packages, see the preinstalled packages changelog.
entry.summary: The apache-airflow-providers-cncf-kubernetes package has been upgraded to version 10.5.0. This update includes changes detailed in the provider's changelog. For a comprehensive overview of all package modifications, please refer to the preinstalled packages changelog.
entry.title: Changed: Airflow kubernetes provider updated to 10.5.0

New Airflow builds are available in Cloud Composer 3:

  • composer-3-airflow-2.10.5-build.7 (default)
  • composer-3-airflow-2.9.3-build.27
entry.summary: New Airflow builds are available for Cloud Composer 3, including the default composer-3-airflow-2.10.5-build.7 and composer-3-airflow-2.9.3-build.27.

entry.content: Cloud Composer version 2.8.3 has reached its end of support period.
entry.summary: Cloud Composer version 2.8.3 is no longer supported. Please upgrade to a newer version to continue receiving support and security updates.
entry.title: Deprecated: Cloud Composer 2.8.3 Deprecation

entry.content:
We're planning to phase out the APIs that aren't required by Cloud Composer 3.

  • Starting February 27, 2026, the following APIs will become fully detachable. Deactivating these APIs won't cause the deactivation of the Cloud Composer API:

  • artifactregistry.googleapis.com

  • cloudbuild.googleapis.com
  • container.googleapis.com
  • pubsub.googleapis.com
  • sqladmin.googleapis.com
  • Starting May 27, 2026, these APIs will no longer be enabled automatically when you enable the Cloud Composer API. To create Cloud Composer 2 environments in new projects, the group of detached APIs must be enabled manually.

Existing Cloud Composer 3 and Cloud Composer 2 environments in projects where the Cloud Composer API is already enabled will not be impacted. You can do the following:

  • After February 27, 2026, if your project has only Cloud Composer 3 environments, then you can manually disable the detached APIs.
  • After February 27, 2026, if your project has Cloud Composer 2 environments, then we recommend keeping these APIs enabled because disabling them might lead to environment's malfunction.
  • After May 27, 2026, if you use automation scripts to provision Cloud Composer 2 environments, then make sure that the listed APIs are enabled in addition to the Cloud Composer API.
entry.summary: APIs not required by Cloud Composer 3 will be phased out starting February 27, 2026. Some APIs will become detachable, and after May 27, 2026, they will no longer be automatically enabled with the Cloud Composer API. Existing environments are not impacted, but users should adjust automation scripts and consider the impact on Cloud Composer 2 environments.
entry.title: Announcement: API Sunset for Cloud Composer 3

entry.content: Cloud Composer pages in the Cloud Console now support the dark color theme. You can switch to the dark theme on the Appearance page in the Cloud Console.
entry.summary: The Cloud Console
entry.title: Feature: Cloud Composer now supports dark theme

entry.content: A new Cloud Composer release has started on June 10, 2025. Get ready for upcoming changes and features as we roll out the new release to all regions. This release is in progress at the moment. Listed changes and features might not be available in some regions yet.
entry.summary: A new version of Cloud Composer is being rolled out starting June 10, 2025, bringing new features and changes. The release is currently in progress and features may not be available in all regions yet.
entry.title: Announcement: Cloud Composer Release Update

entry.content: Fixed an issue that caused Airflow worker and scheduler Pods to be evicted when a large number of tasks was executed.
entry.summary: An issue causing Airflow worker and scheduler Pods to be evicted during high task execution volumes has been resolved.
entry.title: Fixed: Resolved Airflow Pod Eviction Issue

entry.content:
New Airflow builds are available in Cloud Composer 3:

  • composer-3-airflow-2.10.5-build.6 (default)
  • composer-3-airflow-2.9.3-build.26
entry.summary: New builds for Airflow 2.10.5 and 2.9.3 are now available for Cloud Composer 3.
entry.title: Changed: New Airflow builds for Composer 3

entry.content:
New images are available in Cloud Composer 2:

  • composer-2.13.4-airflow-2.10.5 (default)
  • composer-2.13.4-airflow-2.9.3
entry.summary: New images are available for Cloud Composer 2, including composer-2.13.4-airflow-2.10.5 (default) and composer-2.13.4-airflow-2.9.3.
entry.title: Changed: New Composer 2 Images Available

entry.content: Cloud Composer version 2.8.2 has reached its end of support period.
entry.summary: Cloud Composer version 2.8.2 is no longer supported. This version has reached its end of support period. For more information, please refer to the versioning overview.
entry.title: Deprecated: Cloud Composer 2.8.2 Deprecated

entry.content:
Improved the startup times of Airflow workers for environments that have a large number of custom PyPI packages installed.

This change rolls out gradually. In this release, it's available in asia-east1, asia-northeast2, asia-south1, europe-north1, europe-west3, us-east1, us-south1, and us-west2 regions.
entry.summary: We have improved the startup times of Airflow workers, especially for environments that have a large number of custom PyPI packages installed. This enhancement is currently available in asia-east1, asia-northeast2, asia-south1, europe-north1, europe-west3, us-east1, us-south1, and us-west2 regions.
entry.title: Feature: Faster Airflow worker startup times

entry.content: (Cloud Composer 3) If a VPC network is attached to an environment, then all DNS addresses accessed by the Airflow components of the environment are resolved using the Cloud DNS configuration of the VPC network. In particular, Airflow workers that execute DAGs will resolve DNS addresses in this way.
entry.summary: With Cloud Composer 3, Airflow components in an environment will now use the VPC network's Cloud DNS configuration for all DNS address resolutions. This change affects Airflow workers executing DAGs, ensuring consistent DNS resolution within the VPC network.
entry.title: Changed: Cloud Composer 3: VPC Network DNS Resolution

entry.content: (Cloud Composer 3) All newly created private DNS zones are immediately visible to a Cloud Composer environment. Previously, re-attaching a VPC network was required.
entry.summary: Private DNS zones are now immediately visible to Cloud Composer environments, eliminating the need to re-attach a VPC network.
entry.title: Changed: Immediate visibility for private DNS zones

entry.content: (Cloud Composer 3) It's now possible to use zones with cross-project binding. Before this change, cross-project bound zones weren't supported in Cloud Composer 3.
entry.summary: Cloud Composer 3 now supports cross-project bound zones, which were previously not compatible.
entry.title: Fixed: Cloud Composer 3: Cross-project bound zones now supported

entry.content:
(Cloud Composer 2) In Cloud Composer versions 2.11.5 and later, log processing is switching to using OpenTelemetry instead of Fluentd.

This change was announced previously and is gradually rolling out over several releases. In this release, it's available in the following regions: asia-east1, asia-east2, asia-northeast2, asia-northeast3, asia-south2, asia-southeast2, australia-southeast1, australia-southeast2, europe-central2, europe-north1, europe-north2, europe-southwest1, europe-west, europe-west10, europe-west12, europe-west6, europe-west8, europe-west9, me-central1, me-central2, me-west1, northamerica-northeast2, northamerica-south1, southamerica-east1, southamerica-west1, us-east5, us-south1, us-west, and us-west3.
entry.summary: Log processing in Cloud Composer has been updated to use OpenTelemetry instead of Fluentd, starting with version 2.11.5. This change is being rolled out gradually across several releases and is now available in specific regions.
entry.title: Changed: Cloud Composer 2: Log Processing Update

New Airflow builds are available in Cloud Composer 3:

entry.summary: Cloud Composer version 2.8.1 is no longer supported. This version has reached the end of its support period, and users are encouraged to upgrade to a newer, supported version to ensure continued access to updates and security patches.
entry.title: Deprecated: Cloud Composer 2.8.1 Deprecated

entry.content: The Composer Local Development CLI tool is now available in Cloud Composer 3. This tool helps to streamline testing and developing by providing local Airflow environments based on Airflow builds used by Cloud Composer 3.
entry.summary: Test and develop Composer 3 workflows faster with the new local development CLI tool. This feature provides local Airflow environments that mirror the builds used by Cloud Composer 3, simplifying your development process.
entry.title: Feature: New Local Development CLI for Composer 3
